course_title: Contextual Education Elective: Priestly and Prophetic: The Nature of Ritual Performance
class_notes: (Same as SR 628CEE 1) (this course is reserved for MDiv students in Contextual Education II/Teaching Parish II/EASP II; request permission to enroll  by contacting candlerregistrar@emory. edu) (ONLINE: synchronous live sessions Thursday 3:00pm-4:30pm; remaining contact time fulfilled via asynchronous online engagement)
course_description: Ritual action can maintain social stability or provoke social change. Both will be the foci of this course. Through the social scientific study of ritual, we will capture how ritual affects social transformation while investigating ways in which ritual confirms status quo conditions. This course surveys the priestly and prophetic functions of ritual performance in congregational and communal life. (SR628CEE when offered as a Contextual Education Elective)
sections: Class Nbr: 5096, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 3-4:30p, Instructor: N. Phillips, Status: Open
